title: Charging - grounded metal sphere and negative rod

content.question: A negatively charged rod is brought close to, but does not touch, a neutral metal sphere, as shown in Figure <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math>. A wire is then connected between the sphere and ground as shown in Figure <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math>. The wire is later removed, after which the rod is moved far away from the sphere. Which of the following figures best represents how the excess charge, if any, is distributed on the sphereâ€™s surface after the wire and then the rod are both removed?

choices.label: The figure shows a circle with eight equidistant positive charges along its circumference.
The figure shows a circle with eight positive charges along its left side.
The figure shows a circle with eight negative charges along its right side.

content.answer: The figure shows a circle with eight equidistant positive charges along its circumference.
